intro: Strychnos bredemeyeri, commonly known as the African snakewood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red berries containing toxic seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
